description.narrative:
By improving infrastructure at Beirut Port, the project will contribute to the continuity of port operations, focusing on grain handling and critical humanitarian cargo. This infrastructure contribution will be closely coordinated and integrated in the Government’s national plans for the overall rehabilitation of the port. WFP’s proposed contribution to this effort will be two-fold: 1) Establishing temporary bulk and break bulk receiving facility at Beirut Port and 2) Providing cargo handling equipment and operational support assets to support the Government.
To enable operations, WFP will establish emergency telecoms and communications facilities at Beirut Port, and will contract required services, including warehousing, transport, stevedoring, quality control, port superintendence, and fuel delivery and management.
WFP has already airlifted mobile storage units as a temporary storage solution to replace the destroyed silos, as well as lights, generators, and prefabricated office supplies, into Beirut.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Port Augmentation Activities

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS LEBANON RAPID RESPONSE POST-CONFLICT NEEDS 2020

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Establishment of temporary bulk / break bulk receiving facility (overall budget 25 million USD)
Bulk/break bulk capacity restored and able to process up to 20,000MT per week
Horizontal bulk storage facility established to receive and store up to 40,000MT capacity
